sentences.english: Each moment is a gift so do not waste this gift by feeling sorry for yourself or anxious.
sentences.chinese: 每一刻都是生命的赐予，不要因焦虑而虚度光阴。

sentences.english: It has sustained them for generations, providing everything they need to survive.
sentences.chinese: 祂世世代代养活着他们，赐予他们生存所必须的一切。

sentences.english: I praise the Lord for his unfairness of bestowing such pair of eyes and the lips.
sentences.chinese: 我赞美上帝的不公，他赐予你这样的眉眼和嘴唇。

sentences.english: By some good fortune, the universe grants me at least one of those a day.
sentences.chinese: 说不定幸运些，宇宙就会赐予我至少一天那样的时间。

sentences.english: I asked for Windom…. And God gave me Problems to solve.
sentences.chinese: 我祈求智慧，上帝赐予我难题去解决。

sentences.english: The happiest of people don't necessarily havethe best of everything they just make the most of everything thatcomes along their way.
sentences.chinese: 幸福之人并非拥有一切，只是尽力享受生活的赐予。

sentences.english: According to legend human bones remove impurities from the iron and steel and bestow the swords with spirit.
sentences.chinese: 根据传说，人骨使钢铁去芜存菁，并赐予剑魂魄。

sentences.english: The blood belongs to God, since He is the real life-giver.
sentences.chinese: 血是属于上帝的，因祂是生命真正的赐予者。

sentences.english: To me it was the reassuring sound of nature , trying not to be forgotten.
sentences.chinese: 对我而言，这是大自然赐予的令人难忘的静心曲。

sentences.english: If you have a talent, it’s life’s gift to you.
sentences.chinese: 如果你有一种天分，那是生命赐予你的礼物。

sentences.english: You also bestow love upon her or him.
I came here with the intention of requesting the uniform of a Musketeer.
sentences.chinese: 我来此的目的是想请您赐予我一件火枪手军服。

sentences.english: The firm granted him a pension.
You have free will and the God-given power to create.
sentences.chinese: 你拥有自由意志和上帝赐予的创造一切的能力。

sentences.english: Humor is one of the greatest gifts our species has been given.
sentences.chinese: 幽默是我们人类被赐予的最伟大的天赋之一。

sentences.english: On this condition, one gives to the human race the pattern of the ideal.
sentences.chinese: 在这一条件下，我们就能赐予人类理想的模范。

definition: variant of 賜予|赐予[ci4 yu3]
favor/to give charity to sb out of pity
to bestow/to confer (a reward for service)/a reward
to care for/to show concern for/to think longingly (of one's country)
god/spirit/demon/occult or supernatural entities in general
Heaven/Providence/God/the day before/the sky above/to fly to the sky/to take off and fly into space/to die/to pass away
special favor from a ruler/Emperor's generosity towards a favorite
feudal term of praise for ruler, king or emperor/general term for saint in former times/term for God during the Taiping Heavenly Kingdom 太平天國|太平天国/Holy Spirit (in Christian Trinity)
to give a present/to accord (a favor)/to grant
